definition: to dispel (enmity, misunderstandings etc)/to vanish (of misgivings, differences of opinion)/thaw (in relations)
variant of 冰[bing1]
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
to melt away (idiom)/to dissipate/to vanish
to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet

sentences.english: In this way, the divergences between relevant documents can be interpreted easily.
sentences.chinese: 如此，则相关文献记载的分歧与矛盾可以涣然冰释。

sentences.english: The misunderstanding between us has been cleared up.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间的误会涣然冰释。

sentences.english: We've waited six months for him to remedy the breach.
sentences.chinese: 六个月以来我们一直等待他们能够冰释前嫌。

sentences.english: Even Aunt Addie's hostility melted temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 甚至艾迪姨妈的敌意也暂时得以冰释。

sentences.english: In the KaDing under repeated explanations, two into finally animosity, reconciliation. Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 在卡丁的再三解释下，二入终于冰释前嫌，和好如初。

definition: to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
old grievance/former complaint
to forget former enmity (idiom)
to become reconciled/to bury the hatchet
an obstruction/barrier/ill-feeling/grudge
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
to dispel (doubts)/to clear up (misunderstanding)
a matter that gnaws at one's mind/preoccupation/sore point/rancor
former hatred/bygone enmity
to eliminate/to obliterate
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
an old grudge/old scores to settle
to melt like ice and break like tiles/to disintegrate/to dissolve
variant of 芥蒂[jie4 di4]
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
hostility/animosity
